text:
330mL bottle from International Beer Collector. BB 31.5.17
Pours an orange gold body with uniform haze & small white head.
Malty aroma - bread crust, dough, earthy spice, touch of almost apricot character - yeast driven!?
Full body, sort of chewy maltiness about it more akin to an ale, low carbonation aids this.
Toasty sort of malt body - reasonably sweet bread crust & cracker biscuit, flint/slatey earth character these, slightly cellar like even, touch of dried herb & apricot with a firm bitterness to finish.
Not a bad drink, interesting style of beer I really need to find more examples of.

Bottle from Bamberg - clear mahagoni color, almost no head. almost no carbonation, floral notes, wood, grainy, bitter dry finish. medium sweetness. comes close to the real Zoigl I had in the Oberpfalz. Okay.

Hazy golden with little white head. Aroma is vanilla, apricot, pear, fruity, some wood. Taste is some tart malt with with some fruity fresh sour stuff above. Chewy and drinkable. Some gummy bears in the finish.

UPDATED: APR 27, 2017 Bottle. Hazy orange color with white head. Aroma is bready, buttery, juicy malts, pears, a bit honey, herbal hops. Taste is juicy malts, fruity, apricots and pear, vanilla, again herbal and honey with some butter, noticeably hoppy finish. Quite low carbonation. Nice one, could just need a touch more carbonation.

UPDATED: APR 19, 2017 Bottle. Quite classic German style lager, mixing equal parts of honeyish maltiness and sweetness and neutral grassy herbal hops character and bitterness. Rather thin bodied and moderte carbonation. Relatively easy drinking up to a point. Overall good.

On tap at Cafe Sara, august 19th 2016. Lightly hazy golden body with a white head. Grassy aroma with floral hops and sweet malt. Taste is grainy with sweet fruits, banana. Mild bitterness, wet cardboard in finish.

330ml bottle BB 31 May 17. Murky golden amber, almost no head. Muted aroma, but swear I can smell pineapple. The taste is quite fruity for a lager - pineapple and a little papaya, some grass, quite a bit of residual sweetness. Light bodied, very low carbonation. Quite disappointing.

Bottle. Greyish amber, light floaties, offwhite lace. Aromatic hop nose, new world citric. Quite chewy minerally dry full body, hay and bisquit malt, broad grassy, herbal, flowery and citric hops. Light salt in the finish, orangeblossoms retronasal. Pleasant and moreish.
Donkergeel bier met weinig schuim. Smaak is licht bitterzoet en licht kruidig met iets van vanille, abrikoos en citrus.
Kick 250217. Golden color with an off-white head. Aroma is berries, malt, yeast. Flavor is berries, fruit, malt, yeast, hop. Medium body. OK beer.
33cl fles. Gisttroebel goudgeel kleur, grofe witte schuimkraag. Aroma van hooi en gras. Smaak is zoet, mout, gras en citrus. Medium lichaam, veel koolzuur.

Bottled. The aroma has faint grass, hay, grains. Bit hazy, yellow-golden coloured beer with a white, medium head. The taste is medium sweet, has grains, some grass, bit spivy yeast tones. Light-medium bodied. Average.
Bottle. Hazy yellow, white foam. Aroma: malt with spicy and floral hops. Taste: sweet and malty, strong hop bitterness, low carbonation.

Sweet grain and cereal malts, caramel, honey, molasses. Hazy gold, small, frothy, white head. More sweet grain malts, caramel, toffee, very soft carbonation, medium bodied, syrupy texture, some hay, bitterness coming up in the medium long finish. Nice Kellerbier yet, I think it could do with some more carbonation. Bottle from Mother Kellys, Bethnal Green.

Ziemlich cooler Stylecrusher. In der Nase natürlich typisch erdig würzig untergärig, zusätzlich aber auch noch mit einer völlig eigenständigen Sweetfruithefenote. Klasse. Die Optik, zwar zum saftigen Trunk passend, schlammig und ungekrönt, deshalb aber nicht ansehnlicher. Dafür versprüht der extrem interessante Sud, wenig später im Mund einiges an Esprit und reicht obendrauf noch ein üppiges Geschmackssortiment. Honigsüße, Kräuter, Weinverweise und grüner Hopfenbiss spielen hier die ersten Geigen. Juhu. 0,33/2,35 Bottle. Aus dem DE MOLEN Shop!!!!! In Holland!!!!!
Bottled 330ml. -from Pivoteka Zagreb. Unclear pale golden coloured, minimal white head, weak cereals in the nose. Sweetish malty, light cereals, some yeast and grain with dry bitterish finish. So-so.
Colore oro carico tendente allarancio. Aromi di crosta di pane, malto ed un leggero floreale da luppo. In bocca è dolce con note di crosta di pane fiori e malto. Finale amaro.

0.33 l bottle bought by Ogi at Pivoteka, thank you! Shared with Marko and him. Murky golden, small off-white head. Light funky, light citrus, malty. Dry. Watery, light body, soft carbonation, moderate hoppy finish. Interesting, but not that good.

33 cl bottle @ home. Cloudy golden color. Not much head. Aromas: sweet, grain, candy, fruity. Retronasal its sweet, fruity, grain. Flavor is rather sweet, grain. Light bodied. Soft carbonation. Light bitterness in the finish. I have no idea whats so new World (label) about this.

Thanks Ogi! Bottle from Pivoteka. Shared with ogivlado and Hrabren. Misty golden amber body, tiny white head. Malty aroma, light grain, dark bread, lemony note, yeastiness. Creamy, really soft body, slightly oxidized touch of aromatic hoppiness, compote, did I mention it was creamy? Ends abruptly dry and vaguely bitter, in contrast to the rest. Ends slightly dusty. Eh. Not bad but I had somehow hoped for more.
Tap at 100 piv. <:i>Hazy golden volormwith medium white head. Strong yeasty aroma with malt, basement. Taste, yeast, malt, light bitter hops. Good.

Slightly hazy dark golden color with a bit of off-white head. Aroma is quite yeasty, slightly buttery and sweet. Taste follows with the sweet, buttery note, quite grainy, malty, more bitter on the finish but no real hop flavor. Medium body with low carbonation. Overall its an interesting beer style, like an ale/lager hybrid.
Tap at 100 piv. Golden color, creamy white head. Aroma of cereals, apricots, oranges, floral notes. Bitter finish with spicy and smoked notes. Good

Draft @ Brouwcafé de Molen. Pours a hazy golden beer with a nice, firm white head on top. Aroma has hints of sulfide, some flour and grainy notes in there and floral hints as well. Flavor is mildly bittersweet, not too bitter and not too sweet, has some skunky notes in the palate present however. Mildly carbonated, short light bitter aftertaste and overall just a decent beer.

Bottle. Pours is golden with thick white head. Aroma is fruity, malty, bread. Taste is light to moderate bitter, light sweet, malty background, touch of smoked malts on tongue. Medium body, slick texture, light bitter finish.
Golden with white head. Cereal, green grass and floral. Sweet, spicy, clean and very hoppy finish. Great!
Beautiful cloudy pour, though not much head generation. Big flavours here - rich toffee, wheat, full, full bodied with some big bitterness on the back end. A tad soapy, but otherwise top notch.
Gialla velata con schiuma a grana fine bianca. Aroma di malto, paglia e note di agrumi. Al palato dolce, buona con lievito,fieno paglia, funky. Carbonazione media, corpo medio.

Bottle at home. Aroma is grainy malt, hay, grassy hops, straw, yeast, bit sulphury, touch of weeds. Flavour is light to moderate sweet with a sharp bitterness. Body is medium. Tasty Zoigl, bitter favour is a bit on the harsh side though.

33cl bb05/2017 (really, US import/De Molen?) from De Molen shop at Borefts 2016. For fans of Bavarian Upper Palatinate Zoigl, but live further away from Windischeschenbach or Mitterteich than from Bodegraven, this bottled Zoigl seals tye deal on what is else unprecise, wild, earthy and in flux about this Kellerbier: very thick, decocted pour, wild honey or meadlike, little head. Aroma of wayside herbs, melissa, sweet lemon, thaw water, "old washcloth" (InBreak) indeed and sweet barley...farmhouse inside courtyard as well. I love the heavy&near-unctuous mouthfeel, almost like real ale bitter, of this. Lemon barley nectar with some earthy dirt in flavour, sith a bitter nettle/grassy finish. Unlike other rare bottled Zoigls without character, although probably best consumed on site.

Bottle 0.33l from De Bierkoning Amsterdam, The Netherlands. 14.07.2016. Taste with Zlotta. Pour it hazy golden color with medium white head. Aroma sweet grainy note, some honey. Taste sweet grainy feel, maybe little bit missing of carbonation, honey, some funky feel, full body, slick feel, soft carbonation. Ok!
Tap at Mother Kellys, 13th September 16. Pours a hazy yellow. Aroma is citrus, lemon, yeast. Taste is Belgian style yeast, slight sour, citrus, really refreshing, enjoyed this.

Bottle. Hazy golden with a small white frothy head. Honey, flowers, minerals and dry green plants in the nose. Gentle flavour with green plants, honey, flowers, sugar and bread. Medium body, near flat carbonation, some sweetness, mild bitterness. Tastes fine, but the low carbonation makes it too flat.
On tap. Cloudy yellow, minimal white head. Yeast, bread and hay aroma. Sweet bread flavour. Soft carbonation
Draft at RB Best Fest 16: Poured a hazy orange with white head. Aroma was sulfur and grain. Taste was grain and zesty lemon. Awesome refreshing brew!
How: bottle Appearance: slightly hazy deep orange, tiny white head. Aroma: wet grass, herbs, minerales. Palate: very dry mouthfeel, average carbonation, bordering a thin body.

Tap @ Brouwcafe de Molen, small sample. Slight hazy golden color, short creamy head. Bartender (MrHangover) wasnt quite sure it was intended this way, as previous kegs were much better. But Ill give it a small rate anyway. Aroma has quite some diacetyl (a bit too much), slight sulphury, bit skunky even, floral. Taste is much better though, grassy bitterness, slight sulphury and minerally, creamy mouthfeel. Too bad aroma was a bit off, as the taste was fine.

20.08.2016, 0,33l bottle @ hotel room in Oslo:
Small slightly bubbly shortlasting head. Aroma is grainy, wet hay, minerals, wet grain, weeds, old wash cloth, minerals, paper. Taste is dry and harsh floral, weeds, old wash cloth, bark, minerals, paper, harsh grass, flowers, medicine. Medium bitterness, harsh watery mouthfeel. Crap!
My forst zoigl. A little fruity lager. Very nice for a sunny day. Tasted at de molen

0,33l bottle at home. BB 31.05.2017. dark yellow lightly hazy color, small white head. smells sweet, caramel, honey, sweet peppery notes, light plums. rather average smell. medium to full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes rather sweet, honey, light fruity, plums, tobacco, some herbs, peppery. finishes medium bitter with notes of spices and herbs. rather sticky sweet, also (the rather long) finish is kinda unpleasant. probably one of those beers that should not be bottled and only consumed on tap. BB-date is a joke. did not like it.

On tap & Hoppiness Beer Stop. Pours murky clay like color with large soapy white head and good lacing. Aroma of sulphur, yeast, must, cereals and hay. Taste starts light sweet grainy, following is grassy, mild citric and a bit sour, mouthfeel is moderate spicy, while finish is mild bitter. Light to medium body, slick texture and soft carbonation in palate. Unfortunately a bit spoilt...
Leicht trübes hell orange goldenes Bier mit einer mittelgroßen weißen schaumkrone. Geruch angenehm malzig, süß, mild hopfig. Geschmack süß malzig, aromatisch gehopft, mild getreidig, leicht würzig.
Bottle @ Bamberg. Aroma of hay and grains, citrus, rather stale, with a slight peppery note, light tropical with a earthy touch. Tate is rather sweet with a sharp bitternes. Its stale unfortunately.

330ml bottle. Cloudy, orangey golden colour with small, frothy, diminishing, minimally lacing, off-white head. Doughy, spicy yeasty aroma. Taste is minimally sweet doughy, cautious hints of husky malt spiciness, a touch of protein. Smooth and soft palate, soft to flat carbonation. Nice subtle spciness.

0.33 l bottle shared with markoijelena, best before May 2017. Clear, golden amber with a white head. Sweetish, slightly fruity and a little grassy aroma of straw, caramel, honey and some citrus. Sweetish, slightly grassy and a little fruity taste of caramel, honey, straw and some citrus, followed by a short, slightly bitter, a little grassy finish. Medium body, slightly creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Okay!

33 cl bottle. BBE 31.05.2017.
Pours clear golden color with a small white head. Aroma is earthy and somewhat yeasty, mild grainy tones, some weird pumpkin-like spices on the background. Flavor is slightly flour-y, earthy and somewhat malty, some hay also. Simple.
3323

Bottle 500ml. Yellowish-brown with plenty of yeast. Some lacing. Malty aroma with some sweet apple. Malty taste with more pronounced apples and some alcoholic sweetness. Smooth and sticky palate. Light bitterness in the finish. Nice lager.
Bottle. Golden pour. Aroma of grain and malt. Taste of malt, dry grain and bitters. Solid lager.

On tap at ratebeer best festival. Pours out a hazy straw orange topped with a white head. Nose is biscuit malts a grain and wet wheat note along with some spice. Taste is more of the grain light spice and some sweetness.

Keg at RB Best, 31/01/16.
Golden orange with a decent cream cap.
Nose is pale malt, clean, fresh, crackers, grain, light citric notes, bread.
Taste comprises pale malt, soft bread, caramel, light orange, toasted grain.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Crisp clean lager ... could crush lots of this one!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Pours hazy golden with a nice, lager-appropriate head, with a quite strong hoppy aroma. Taste is somewhat fuller than I would expect of a lager beer, very nice body, some sweet taste, which quickly switches to a hoppy bitter and evolves in to a nice, subtle, slightly dry finish. This is one hell of a lager!

How: Bottle.
Where: Systembolaget.
Appearance: Golden colour with a white head.
Aroma: Fruit, hops, bread, malt.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Malt, bread, fruit, caramel, some hops.
Bottle from systembolaget sweden. Malty aroma and a bit tired hop. Sweet malty taste with a spicy bitterness.

50cl bottle @ home, 3/4-16.
App: Hazy brownish yellow with a 2 finger fluffy white sticky head.
Aroma: Sweet dough, oranges and apricot puree, white bread and grass.
Taste: Also quite sweet and doughy with apricot puree and oranges, flowers, grass and freshly baked wheat bun. Vanilla?
Palate: Medium big, soft carb, sticky chewy texture.
Overall: A bit sweeter and clumsier than expected, but still very nice robust flavours.

UPDATED: APR 18, 2016 @Helsinki Beer Festival 2016sample. Light golden, faint citrus lime on nose, pils lagey, crackers. Light med bldied, crisp nice dryish finish. Pretty tasty crisp crafty lage.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Bottle at HBF2016. Hazy golden color, small white head. Sweetish malty aroma. Medium-bodied. Sweetish, grassy, a bit toffeish, nice leafy aftertaste. Good.
50cl bottle. Golden color, thin white head. Earthy, grainy, malty mild sweet aroma. Flavor has grains, earth, dusty like, minerals, excellent.

Poured up on tap at RBWG16 where it exhibits a deep gold hazy body that supports a light tan head of foam. The aroma offers up grassy to herbal to spicy and floral hops; this smells full of hops. The taste is similar as I get grassy and herbal and spicy hops as well as some floral and flowery notes going from front to back. This has pleasing hop bitterness with a smooth easy sessionable flavor sensation.

Draft. Medium white head atop cloudy apple cider body. Aroma is medium sweet, bread, some lemon, light sweat sock. Taste is moderately sweet, cantaloupe, some bread, light lemon/orange. Light-medium body, light effervescence.
Bärnstensfärgad grumlig med vit skum. Doftar lite svavel och smakar marsipan. Väldigt konstig öl med lite bottensats
SB beställning, flaska. Frisk arom fin färg med komplex smak. Helles ligth ipa nånting. Riktigt behaglig.

Pours a hazy orange golden color, topped with a medium big white head. Aroma of some slight soury grains, some spicy feel to it, a bit of bread notes. Taste starts bready with some grassy feel, bittery with quite noticeable spicy presence, peppery in the finish. Lighter body, and nicely drinkable.

Bottle. Hazy warm deep orange color with a massive foam dissipates quickly leaving lots of lacings. Stunning to lool at! Aroma is bready, citrus, grain, floral, herby, slight sweet. Taste is complex, with sweet bready notes paired with orange and citrus, yeasty notes, pepper leading up to a dry, peppery bitter finish. Surprisingly big and round body for its ABV, low carbo. Lovely, Andreas knows his shit.

Flaska från SB. Vacker djup varm gyllenfärg med lite sediment, lågt krämigt skum. Doft av säd, honung, gula plommon, mandel och lite parfym. Otroligt mjukt och stort i munnen. Stor kropp och stor smak. Säd, lite jordig jästighet, honung, söta mogna gula plommon och päron, äppelkaka med vaniljsås, lite örter, gräs och hö som bygger en mjuk men påtaglig beska. Ett stort öl som liknar en belgisk trippel trots sina endast 5,8%abv. Komplext, fint nyanserad smakbild. Fantistiskt.

The aroma of perfume and berries. Light taste of berries, slightly fruity and perfumed. Light bitterness that fills the mouth for a long time. Very special flavor to the beer. Would not recommend this beer. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

Birch and Barley, DC tap: pours golden with haze and a white head. Aroma is grass, earthiness, grain. More pronounced than your average pils. Dirty in all it attitude. Bitter and lingering. Nice earthiness and bitterness in taste without sacrificing any of the smoothness.
Draft at Churchkey. Hazy to cloudy golden color, bright white head. Earthy root cellar aroma. Taste is earthy lemon and straw. Tasty.
500ml bottle. Hazy yellow/orange body with a medium white head. Lacing. Fruit, citrus, grass, herbs.
Pours hazy orange with a medium white head. Aromas of rye bread, citrus, musk, farmhouse, minerals. Taste is earthy and dusty with mineral notes. Mouthfeel is light bodied with medium carbonation.

Bottle from systembolaget. 
Pours golden with a white head. 
Deep malty bready aroma. 
Smooth malty, some banana, wheat and balanced bitterness.

Bottle
Golfen, white head
Aroma of yeast, honey
Taste round bitter and sweet. Nice texture. Bitter finish!
Flaska från SB. Smak och doft av humle, malt, bröd, citrus, honung, örter. Rund och len, rena smaker, mycket bra balans, lagom sötma, fin beska. Riktigt gott!

Ljus och lite grumlig. Örtig och bröd i doft. Lagersmak med en fin sötma, bland den bästa lager jag druckit

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Flaska, ebest SB. Dimmigt mörkgul med ett medelstort smutsvitt skum. Dofter av malt, citron, gräs och lätt av smör. Smakinslag av citron, malt, karamell och gräs. Väldigt gott kort och gott.
Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty grainy grassy aroma. Fruity malty grainy grassy weak bitter flavor. Has a fruity malty grainy grassy finish.

February 28, 2016. Bottle, best before November 14, 2016.

Hazy orange with a dense creamy white head. Aroma is malty with crisp, clean grainy notes, white bread, floral, slight herbal, some honey and citrus notes. Taste is light to medium sweet, light soft bitterness. Finish is sweet malty with some honey notes, soft balancing bitterness with a slight dry grassy touch, some herbal notes, minerals and hints of citrus. Medium bodied, soft to average carbonation. 
Great, clean malty and hoppy.

Draft pour at RB Best. Pours a hazy deep gold with a very big frothy off-white head. Notes of straw, pale and bready and crackery malts, florals, and faint citrus. Medium-bodied, with medium frothy carbonation and a bitter, malty mouthfeel. Great balance. Super drinkable. Great stuff.

Pours milky yellow with low white head
Aromas of milky bread, wheat, hay, hints of herbs and citrus, wee bit corn
Taste has bready malts, oatmeal, citrus, herbs, bitter hoppyness
Medium bodied, semi dry with medium bitter finish.

Benvitt huve som sjutton! Grumlig som en grumlig grundare! Nästan olika nyanser av nån apelsin juice där det är ljusare längre ner i det kupade glaset, coolt! Fantastisk doft av sädesslag! Korn någon! Blandad med unken källarnyans, små söt smak tydligen från kornet, även i smaken går kornen igenom & sätter sig på tungan som en havremjölk, nästan som att dricka korn?mjölk, överlag lätt kropp å lätt knapp efterbeska

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle bought @ Systembolaget. Pours tiny hazy pale golden with a frothy white head that leaves lots of spotty sticky trace on the glass. Smell is malty and floral with crackers, freshly baked white bread, honey, hay, dried yellow flowers, minerals and lemon peal. Taste is slightly sweet, slightly bitter, malty and floral. Mouthfeel is soft, round, tiny dry, tiny astringent, tiny oily and medium bodied. Finish is slightly sweet and slightly bitter with crackers, freshly baked white bread, honey, hay, minerals and lemon peal. Divine German beer packed full of all that bready malt and floral hops goodness. Balanced and so damn full of flavour. Love it!

UPDATED: AUG 19, 2016 Bottle (50 cl) from Systembolaget. Shady golden, large white head. Bready, grainy malt aroma, herbal and grassy hops. Medium bodied, softn carbonation. Semi dry, medium to high bitterness.

500ml bottle. Semi-hazy golden with one finger white head. Aroma of bitter herbs, citrus, apricot, light caramel, light bread and fresh grass. Taste is bitter herbal, citrus, sweet malts, light caramel and ripe apricots. Medium, very smooth mouthfeel, medium carbonation and lasting bitter herbal aftertaste intermingled with sweet caramel.

Bottle from Systembolaget. 

Golden with a white head. Aroma of grass, bread, some hops and some apricot. Similar taste. The body was medium as was the bitterness. Nicely balanced and easy to drink. I liked this one.

Aroma breaks through that soft and cuddly foam head and brings delicate crisp malts and a tender subtle hop profile. Slight lemon juice. Taste is really smooth and elegant. A slight herbal touch lingers over a sweet but still also crisp malts and the finish is fruity and estery.

50 cl bottle on February 20, 2016, thanks to Ingo! From Systembolaget.BB 14.11.16.Malty, crisp, clean, herbal, hoppy scent. Clear golden color, fluffy white head with lacing. Sweet, herbal hoppy, malty, slight bitter taste. Herbal hoppy, fresh aftertaste. Medium though sort of low CO2 mouthfeel, medium crisp bitterness. Lingering bitterness.Very nice with noble hop character, well balanced, highly drinkable.
500ml Bottle - Golden with a slight haze and a foamy head. Grass, lemon zest and some earthy notes in the aroma. Refreshing taste with bread, lemon zest and a crisp hoppiness.

bottle @ home. Pours a hazy golden liquid with a medium sized off white, creamy head. Nicely balanced aroma of flowers, grass, bread, grain, apricots and honey. Big, extremely smooth and yet crisp/dry body with average carbonation. The taste is malty and has notes of apricots, grass, bread, cream, honey, some spiciness and red apples. All in a nice balance and along with the smooth malty body this beer exhibits a great complexity. Citrus, earth, spruces and an increasing, balanced, bitterness in the finish.

Bottled from Systembolaget
Golden with a white head. 
Cereal, grassy, spicy aroma. 
Malty, slightly smoked, flavour. 
Medium to high bitterness.
On tap at Ratebeer Best. Pours a hazy yellow gold with medium white head. The aroma is floral, wheat, earth. Medium mouth, fruity malt, grass, light bitterness, very good.
Ljus, grumlig. Massor skum som lägger sig till ca en cm. Luktar tysk öl. Smakar lite beskare än jag trodde. God ändå.

500ml bottle from Systembolaget. Hazy bright golden with a rich lacing white head. Fresh grassy and fruity aroma, citrus, bread and toffee. Rich smooth mouthfeel. Fresh hoppy taste, red apple, grapes, peach, biscuits and bread. Floral finish, hay and grass. Very well balanced drinkable and refreshing!

Gul, disig med stort vitt skum. Stor maltig doft, brödig, med inslag av örter, aprikos och lite citrus. Stor, fyllig, maltig smak med fina örttoner och fruktighet i form av aprikos och citrus, en stor fin beska kommer smygande och balanserar upp maltsötman och sitter i länge. En suverän lager! Välbalanserad, smakrik, fyllig och alldeles, alldeles ... fantastisk!

Grass, hay, minerals, bread, herbal
Golden colour, dense medium head, good amount of lacing.
Medium bite, mid-sweet, rich and herbal grassy hoppiness.
Medium body, soft carbonation, bitter finish.
[1/31/16] Draught sample at RateBeer Best festival in Santa Rosa. Cloudy golden. Vegetal lager yeast and grassy hops aroma. Dry flavor with lager yeast, grains, bitter grassy hops. Medium-bodied.

On tap at RateBeer Best. It pours a golden color with an off white head. The aroma is strong with fresh baked bread, bread crust and minor notes of floral noble hops. Great complex pale malt notes. The flavor is intensely malty and dry with some bread, toast, bread crusts, light baking yeast and some spicy, floral hops that make for a strongly bittered finish. So well balanced, dry and drinkable. A real outlier against all the trendy beers at this festival, but it stood out because of that. I could drink this all day.

Draft. Straw beer with a whitish head. Bready sweet malt aroma with light grassiness. Creamy malt flavor with light breadiness, grass, and light floral notes. Medium bodied. Light sweet bready malt lingers with light backing hops and light grass. Very nice.

Sample at the RateBeer Best festival 2015. Sadly I was dragged there by @@ron while asking who the hell Gahstaller is anyway? Pours hazy straw, medium white head, good lacing. Aroma is bready, grass, floral notes, grain. Flavor is light sweet and medium bitter, lots of grassy floral hop presence along with bready grainy malts. Lightish body with a soft mouthfeel. A bit more bitter than my ideal, but a strong offering nonetheless, and a fitting end to a great evening.

Draught at RateBeer Best festival. Light hazy light orange liquid with small white head. Aroma of bread, light earth, floral hops, light grain and noble hops. Taste is very light sweet and light bitter with notes of bread, earth and floral hops. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Great, very crushable.
On tap at ratebeer best. Hazy pale gold pour with thin white head. Aroma is super hoppy, nice and grassy, fresh bready grainy notes. Taste is malty, nice grassy bitterness. Really solid.

On tap at the Birre Sotto l'Albero festival in Rome-ITALY (Macche and Bir&Fud). Pours live golden hazy color, huge off white head. Nose: bread yeast, melon, fresh summer fruit, bread crust. Mouth: medium-high carbonation, round consistency, bread, bitter light end. Enjoyable. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

At Moeder Lambic Fontainas, with S&G Tasting group, first day trip.
APPEARANCE: light clouded blond beer, nice stable white head.
NOSE: wheat, fruity.
TASTE: wheat, fruity, little chemical.
FDBK 2010 The head is ok. it smells flowery, hoppy. The taste is a bit sweet, yeasty-bitter. Drnkable

Draught @ Akkurat. Pours orange with a big white head. This beer is just great! Its has a very fruity base... apricots, orange. The malts taste like cereal. The hops are flowery and herbal. Bitter and slightly spiced/smoked finish. Quite dry in aftertaste. Everything is in perfect balance!

UPDATED: APR 21, 2013 
Draught @ HBF13
Aroma has soapy citrus and some grain. Feels like a witbier. Flavour has some citrus, hay and wheat. A bit sticky but refreshing still, a kellerbier on the wit side. Reminds me of Hopfenpflücker.

Draught @ HBF 2013

Pours clear golden orange with a foamy head. Aroma of grassy notes, malts, hops and fruits. Taste is fruity and mildly farmyardy with notes of grass and yeast. Finish is sweetish and soapy with hints of fruits and grass. Okay, quite tasty zoigl.
Draught at HBF 2013, Helsinki. Colour is clear golden with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Grain, sweetness and malts.
@BBF12. Pours yellow with a white head. Aroma is malt and light grapefruit. Flavour is malt, grapefruit and light yeast.

From tap @Borefts 2012.  Clear gold. Firm white head. Crisp grainy and caramelly malts, and herbal/grassy hops in the aroma.  Bread crust and a toffee-ish malt flavor. Fruity and herbal tones underneath. Balancing bitterness. Light to medium full. Sweetish malty endnotes.

Clear golden color. Small amount of white bubbles. No lacing. Yeasty malt and cereal aroma. An almost dishwater nose as well. Sweet yeasty flavor. Sweet finish with a slight citrus presence. Only slight. Not bad.

On [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ (Rome). Hazy yellow body with a tall foamy white head. Fresh malty aroma. Taste is fresh bread, with a pleasant and long grassy hoppy finish

On tap @ Borefts 2012. This is a near clear golden one with a massive big dense white top. Smells really different. Caramel and needles. Strange-bitter with some buttery tones. Not to impressive really. Its soft on the carbonation with a light oily mouthfeel. Good fruity sweet flavors. Low bitterness. Caramel-malty toffee like with canned pineapple and pears. I kinda like it, but its not fantastic or to impressive really. 28.09.2012

Sample at Borefts Beer Festival 2012. Pours a hazy and golden beer with a white head. The aroma is malt and hops. The flavor follows the nose with additional bitterness. The palate is bitterness. Overall an average beer.
Per me di sicuro la migliore keller in circolazione . manca qualcosina al naso ma gia dal primo assaggio capisci che è una birra con tanto carattere .

UPDATED: NOV 20, 2012 the last beer @ afterparty BBF wich we got to break into  (lol) 
blonde, white steady foam. smells and taste rather sweet, honey caracter, light ( low alcohol ) 

update : just heard this keg was slightly infected, and so some of this information might be irrelevant ! will re-rate when drank again !

Clear golden colour, firm white head. Aroma of boiled egg, yeast, overcooked Brussels sprouts, cooked vegetables, cookies and light urine. Sweet malty flavour, quite fresh, yeast and light flowery hops. Light nuts and caramel. Malty finish, light sweetness.
The nose wasnt too nice on this one, the rest is spot on. Im guessing some sort of infection could be blamed for the strange aroma. Warrants a re-rate in the future.
(Draught @ 4th BBF, Bodegraven 2012)
at De Molen Festival 2012 ...  Golden amber ... thin white head ... soft zezty leomon peach hop ... soft floral nose .. mellow creamy fruits ... osft floral hop...

On tap at Borefts 2012, Bodegraven. Pours clear, yellow gold with a lively white froth head. Tangy pale malt nose, some lemon hints. Medium sweet flavor, herbal, with ripe lemon and pale malts. Light bodied with average carbonation. Sugary sweet finish with some melon, grapefruit and more lemon. Far too sugary sweet. I like this style of beer, but this example was a bit too sweet.

Draught at Gallows Bird, Espoo. Poured slightly hazy goldenbronze with thin white head. Sweet toffee and sweet malt on the nose at first. Hay and some exotic fruits also. Sweet, toffee and very fruity tropica fruits in flavour. A bit of some mild spices also in aftertaste. Very light hoppyness in finish.

Tap on Borefts 2012. Pours clear golden with a big creamy white head. Aroma of yeast,dusty malts. Taste is moderate sweet, with some good dry hops mixed in, some light barnyard, also got that moreish feel, good one.

Draught @BBF12:
Big creamy white head changes slowly into a white lacing on top of an almost clear bright yellow colored beer.
Smell cooked vegetables, sauerkraut, earth, cookies, urine Not your average smell for a beer on Borefts, but the more interesting the taste will be.
Absolutely better taste than smell: lot of vegetables, some hops, malts, yeast, light flowery and some light nutty caramel notes, light medium bitter.
Short yeasty vegetable malt and grass aftertaste.
Low carbo, soft mouthfeel, medium body and a creamy texture.
Smell I strange and not really good, the taste is a lot better. Not bad att all this beer.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Served from a jug at Borefts 2012. Hazy gold with a nice white head. Promisingly hoppy aroma spoilt by a strange and off-putting smell of sewage. Not sure Id call it watery but it felt bloated and empty at the core with regards to mouthfeel, if that makes sense. Finishes well though with good fruity character. Bizarre but oddly charming through it all.
Tasted at the 4th BBF @ De Molen. Hazy light yellow pour, aroma of brett, German hops and citrus. Flavor is spicy, creamy, slightly bitter and some funky earth.
Draught @ Borefts 12. Hazy pale yellow color, small white head. Omg I so dislike this. Aroma and taste are like dishwasher-water or an unclean toilet. Yuk! Watery texture, unfresh, just really bad.

Draft @ Borefts 2012. The pours light gold with a eggy white head. The nose is honey, soft white bread, bakery. The taste is much the same. Softly sweet and approachable. Just a hint of herbal hop on the finish. Crisp, smooth. Overall, this was a welcomed change of pace during a festival dominated by high gravity monsters!

UPDATED: OCT 28, 2016 Golden colour with light haze. Virtually no carbonation. Has a really smooth malty taste. Very subtle dryness in the finish. Could do with a touch of gas to liven it up a bit.  --- Old rating 3.0 (Probably infected). Clear blond colour. Aroma of barnyard and fresh malt. Very smooth and silky. Lots of malt and yeast flavour with a bite of dry hop in the finish.

UPDATED: NOV 20, 2012 Draft @ BBF12Hazy blond, big white head. Aroma is funky, hoppy with a bit of a campsite toilet smell as well : Bit like a toilet aged saison. Edit: Turns out beer was infected...

Pale golden color with a white head. The nose is a bit on the floral and fruity side with some straw notes. A biscuit malt sweetness and a touch of dough. The flavor is also quite heavy on the biscuit and dough malt sweetness. Lots of sweet fruity esters with a light floral hoppiness.

Draught 4th Borefts 2012. A clear golden colored beer, with a thick foamy white head. The aroma of malts, fruits and a little sour. The taste is soft malty, sweet and a little sour notes. The aftertaste of soft fruits with some bitter notes.

UPDATED: NOV 20, 2012 Tap @ Borefts. Golden color, hazy. Malty cellar aroma. Malty flavor, sweetish with ripe fruit. Cellar notes. Butter. Not flawless but tasty and the beer grows on you. Probably slightly infected, so needs a re-rate. And a seperate journey to the Drie Kronen brewery ;-)

On tap at Borefts. Initially not impressed with this, but the more I drank the better it became... Pours clear amber/orange with white head. Aroma of citrus and hops. Medium bodied with flavour of sweet malt and some citrus with underlying dryness. Bitter lasting aftertaste.
Light hazy orange body and creamy white head. Oranges, light spicy, dough base. Nice. Fine mouth feel, yet active. Medium bitter. Very drinkable and fresh. Nice. (At Borefts 2012)
Draft. Pours bright orange with a fluffy white head. Sweetish malts, with some light grainy notes, lingering toffee-like sweetness, and a hint of doughy bread.
Draught at Chez Moeder Lambic, Fontainas, Brussels. Golden yellow a bit hazy beer with big lacy offwhite head. Fudge, fruity and hoppy aroma. Simliar flavour. A nice beer :-)
On tap at Cafe Abseits, Bamberg 15/7/2012. Cloudy amber in colour with a decent, off-white head. Sweet, grainy malts, a touch of fruitiness and slightly bitter finish. Fine.

02/08/2012 Ma che siete venuti a fà (tap). Bionda, limpida, schiuma bianca abbondante e persistente. Aroma magnifico, straodinariamente armonioso, di pane, malto, cereali, miele, luppolo. In bocca mostra un mirabile equilibrio, con un attacco maltato, con note di pane al latte, e un finale luppolato delizioso. Wow! Corpo medio-basso, carbonazione corretta, grandissima bevibilità. Birra straordinaria, da bere e ribere senza pietà! La migliore Zoigl mai bevuta, e di gran lunga!

UPDATED: JUN 18, 2016 Draught at Chez Moeder Lambic, Fontainas. Somewhat hazy pale yellow beer with a nice white head. Malty bready aroma, fruity, hoppy, grass, toffee notes, hoppy fruity flavor, bready, apples, grapes, biscuits, sourish notes, some grass. Fruity bready finish. Nice.

Tap @ Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Slightly hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, butter and moderate hoppy - fruity, citrus and grass. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 170712

Tasted at the brewery with Andreas. Cloudy yellow orange appearance with a big white head. Big yeasty/bready, light citrusy, huge floral hoppy aroma. Lightly toasted cracker, bready grainy, chewy malty, lemon citrusy flavor. One of the finest German beers Ive ever tasted. BRAVO.

Draught at Moeder Lambic (Fontainas) 

Pours a hazy golden color with a big fluffy white head and good lacing on the glass. 

The aroma is earthy and grassy, some saltiness, a lot of floral elements, and a nice bread dough character. At first it was buttery, this settled down as it sat, this would be a near perfect score for aroma but genuinely it was off putting at first and got awesome from there. 

The flavor is pretty gosh darned wonderful, very earthy, very grassy, it starts sweet and malty but finishes very dry. Loads of herbal hop bitterness are abound here. 

I want to go drink this at the source, because this was very very good but reading a few of the previous reviews from samplings at source it sounds like this is magical.

Draught at Moeder Lambic, FontainasCloudy golden color, with large head, leaving behind a nice lace. Nice aroma, taking you back immediately to some back-country German biergarten; delicate malt and butter. It doesnt have much carbonation an the mouthfeel is therefore more round; malt flavor, almost sweetish, with clear butter preSence, although not rancid; there is some grass too; the bitterness is medium low.Perfect beer for the garden, with a BBQ if possible; but it seems to be beyond freshness.

Tap in Straßgiech at the Zoiglstube, 0,5L for only 2.  Lightly hazy but glowing golden with a lacing bright white head, instantly recognized as gorgeous.  Very sweet fruity nose, this is amazing, various melons, strawberry, kiwi, grapefruit, pineapple, wow.  In the mouth, a firm bitterness to best many IPAs, keeps its sweet fruitiness.  The fruit rind with light astringency reminds me of the Obstsalat I had this morning.  Smooth and malty fullish body.  One of the best lagers Ive had, period, and I have little doubt I could drink this every day for the rest of my life.  Incredible.

On draught at Chez Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Pours a golden colour with a thick white head. Aroma of bready yeast, caramel and a little grass. Similar flavours with moderate carbonation and a foamy mouth-feel.

Draft @ Moeder Lambic, Fontainas.
Dorée, col blanc épais et crémeux.
Arôme rappelant un bouquet beurre que javais déjà gouté ailleurs en Allemagne, profile fleuri et houblonné très agréable et doux, note de grains allant vers le maïs et autres grains concassés.
En bouche, malté aspect beurre, caramel rappelant un peu le maïs le tout sur une amertume modérée. Profile houblon reste dans une lignée très allemande, noble et fleuri vers le Saaz ou Hallertau.

Had this from draft at the Chez Moeder Lambic Fontainas on Fri 23rd March 2012 with Loz and in company of Simon & Jackie  Pours orange amber with a white head, rather murky, hazy and distinctly muddy looking not the best looker. Fruity and malty with a very steady and low level bitterness, some biscuit and a softness about this that is most agreeable. I cannot get excited by this beer, however I did enjoy it.  A7 A3 T7 P4 Ov14  3.5

50 cl. draft in mug at Chez Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Golden body with puffy head. Corny nose and also quite spicy. Taste also quite spicy and malty. Nice prickly texture with some fruits in the house. Enjoyable.

50 cl. draft in a dimple mug @ Chez Moeder Lambic Fontainas: clear golden with a creamy white head, very delicious, creamy, sweet with a touch of honey, lots of banana, creamy sweet hay, delicious sweet malts, hint of sweet dough, white sugar, slight hint of hop bitterness in the finish which eventually by the end slowly starts coating your mouth, nice

The best Zoiglbeer i ever drink.
Very smooth, very balanced and easy drinking. Good ingredients meets a good brewmaster. Drink and enjoy no more to say.

UPDATED: NOV 30, 2013 draft at the zoiglstube.  normally on every friday but the friday i show up, but pulled from a keg in the back by Andreas.  hugely hoppy nose: prickly, green, grassy, zesty.  yeast must, hop oils, honey biscuit malt, fruity orange, lemon and melon notes, zingy green hop flavor.  honey biscuits and just-toasted grains... wow. its musty but completely soft; rustic and yeasty with noble hops as bright as they have ever been. floral yogurt is there at times with zingy, bright acid and bitterness, neither of which even approach brash or harsh or excessively out of balance.  I want to be a critic and find something about this I dont like but its very difficult.  I could maybe give this anywhere between a 4.4 to 4.8, but in that range you cant pick apart what separates one from another, rather for me its about where it ranks in your beer drinking life experiences.  that said, this has to be the best zoiglbier in Germany. I went into this with TAR and Ernests impressions fresh and Im always careful to be aware of bais from that sort of exposure, and usually Im more of a critic if other folks recently have "wow" moments with something, but this really is it.  Ive been through Bavaria twice before this trip and Ive been trying as much zoigl as I can, and this one is otherworldly.

Draught in Strassgiech: Golden orange. Stiff, everlasting spackle foam. Charmingly rustic nose of cotton candy, orange marmalade, dusty yeast, peach fuzz and lemon rind. Fine, feathery, tiny-bubbled carbonation; much akin to a pristinely-conditioned cask ale. Initially hop-drenched with a captivating tandem of floral nectar and spicy nobles. Scratchy whispers of sprucelike hops produce a minty glow as ample licorice-tinged bitterness intensifies and accentuates the deeply flavorsome hops. Mild black-pepper tingle exudes as well. The resounding brightness and masterful cleanness on display here is simply unmatched. Hops continue to dazzle and transcend as the palate receives a bathing of fresh flowers and ever so delicate orange-blossom nectar. Simply an otherworldly hop profile. Nary a trace of bitterness to be detected, for this is ALL about the delicacy and coaxing every last nuance from the cone. The center boasts a marmalade fullness, giving the perception of residual sugar, which gracefully coalesces with the honey-drizzled toasty malt. Ghostlike malt has the weight of dust, yet somehow is beyond vivid and flavorful. Closes with breathtaking balance and finesse, as a dry, deep-rooted toastiness continues alongside the explosive nectar-filled hops. This is one of those rare moments where paralysis is induced through a seemingly dreamlike experience.  A downright magnificent achievement in the field of brewing, and an absolutely superlative  creation that has opened my eyes to the limitless potential beer holds.
user_location: Blue Ridge Mountains, North Carolina, USA

text:
Draft in Strassgiech.

Head is initially large, frothy/creamy, white, fully lasting.
Body is hazy dark yellow.

Aroma is moderately malty (toasted grain), moderately hoppy (flowers, herbs), with notes of honey and tangerine nectar.

Flavor is moderately to heavily sweet, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly to moderately sweet, moderately bitter.

Medium to full body, velvety texture, lively carbonation.

Yep, 5.0.  First 5.0 in seemingly forever.  I had a bunch of dreadful-to-lukewarm beers in Franconia on this recent trip (and certainly some good ones too), but this one blew me out of the water.  Utterly and completely.  Id even forgotten what a 5.0 experience is like.  People who know me know I dont get excited very much.  Even 4.0 beers scarcely elicit a smile.  This thing had me shouting, writhing, bouncing, grinning, beaming, dancing, and generally behaving like a moron.  Every time I went back for a sniff and a sip, I was transported to a sort of beer nirvana...a state free of flaws and full of pure delight.  500mL of this and every single drop was ecstasy.  I highly doubt anyone else will have a 5.0 experience with this beer, maybe not even a 4.0.  A 5.0 is one of those situations thats as much (or more) visceral than clinical.  Yes, the appearance, aroma, flavor levels/balance, and mouthfeel all have to be astounding and flawless, which is rare enough by itself.  But beyond that, it also has to ROCK YOUR FUCKING WORLD in a way that defies descriptors.  This did all of that.  If I had it again, would it still be a 5.0? Maybe, maybe not.  Andreas himself wasnt completely satisfied with this batch and claimed he had a new one going that was more hoppy...so Ill probably never have this incarnation again anyway.  Regardless, this was one of the best beers Ive had in my life.

Vollmundiger Antrunk mit deutlich hefiger Note, dazu aromatisch hopfig. Auch weiterhin aromatisch und überaus hopfig, was mittelfristig zu deutlicher Trockenheit führt. Hellmalzig, gelungen, sehr süffig. 12/11/11/12//11

Festival der Bierkulturen 15.05.2010 
Hefiger, leicht hopfensüßlicher Geruch. Leicht bitterer Antrunk, süßlicher werdend gleitet das Bier in eine hefige Mitte. Etwas energischer abbitternd im Ende. Recht schmackhaft.

Draught; Trabelsdorf-brewed, 3 months old Clear copper-gold colour with a huge, very dense & fine head, leaving beautiful lace. Fresh & toasted & oxydized maltsmix - special, but MALTY! Honey, sweet malts, unreal cookies. Oxydized honey, but good! Finish is slighlty dry-bitterish, as from old, but non-cheesy hops. Slick, as from the grist, creamy MF, velvety texture. GENIUS lager. Even the oxydation tastes good.

Since I am a very German Pils lover, I cant say nothing bad about this beer. The taste is not to much bitter, very thirst quenching and if served at the right temperature is something very delicious.
I think this beer should be present wherever you go, as regard places selling handcraft beers because of its simplicity and easy to drink. The body, is all in all light, when the carbonation is rather soft. I appreciate it very much.
Hoppy, bitter, enough malts to balance. Easy drinking. Wont go out of my way to search it out, but if it crosses my path again by chance, I wont hesitate to try again.
Nose of bitter hops,  watered down some, feel is broad, carb is heavy, taste is middle-of-the-road

(draught at Festival der Bierkulturen, Köln) Cloudy, pale golden colour with a short foamy white head. Quite yeaste, pale malty and slightly worty aroma with subtle fruity notes and herbal hops. Sweet-bitter flavour, light to medium bodied with a lively, almost sharp carbonation. Pale malt-character, grainy and worty taste with herbal accents; dry and bitter hoppy, also a bit slim finish with a rounded malty sweetness. Lacks maturation, otherwise okay. 16.V.10

On Tap at the GBBF, Earls Court 06/08/2010
Malt aroma. Amber coloured a little hazy in appearance and malty with a hint of dryness in a pale and slightly bitter lasting finish.

UPDATED: OCT 31, 2016 Draught at the Sandkerwa festival, Bamberg. Cloudy dark gold, super-fine head. Aroma of grassy, earthy hops, and a touch of honey. Very hoppy--grass and citrus. Clean and dry but with rich, bready malts. Super smooth, almost flat. Huge peppery hop finish. Rich and soft malt. Wonderful! Lots of cereals, some honey. Best of the fest. (Bottled in Japan: 3.9. Lacking the sharp bitterness and some of the richness of the tap version, but still excellent.)

UPDATED: NOV 10, 2012 6th August 2010. GBBF. Hazy gold beer with a creamy off white head. Softish semi dry palate. Typical German freshness. Caraway malt with a little orange hop in the background. Soft finish. Original Rating 3.1. 28th September 2012Borefts Beer Festival IV. Day 1. As Naturtrub Zeiglbier. Creamy pale malt - with that nice German nutty quality. Tiny bit of herb and a nice mild citrus hop. Semi dry finish. Decent.

Draught		GBBF 2010.  A slightly hazy golden beer with a big white head and lacing.  A buttery aroma with noble hops.  Hops and creamy malts in the mouth.  Too chewy by half and nowhere near crisp and hoppy enough.

Golden colour, mediumized white head. Aroma is diacety, fruits, some mild spices and earthcellar. Flavour is diacetyl, grass, some mild notes of yeast and caramel. Aftertaste is diacetyl, grass and some mild earthyness.
From tap. Pours hazy orange with a huge, thick and off-white head. Aroma is grassy and slight yeasty. Bitter, crisp and grassy hops flavoured. Dry and crisp bitter finish.

Draught. Hazy nice deep golden colour with a medium white head. Aroma has toastey malt and a pleasant hoppiness. Good mouthfeel. Pleasant fresh toasty malty caramel and hoppy flavour, pleasant bitterness.

(Draught at Mikkeller Bar) Poured golden and hazy. Head was medium sized and white. Aroma was fruity and citric. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were fruitiness, herbalness, grain, grass and bitterness. Aftertaste was grassy and bitter.

tap at mikkeller bar
cloudy yellow, smooth white head.
aroma is dry, dusty, faint malty.
flavor is dry, faint sweet and sort of hoppy, bitter and herbal note, ends hoppy. got better with time/warming up

Draught at Mikkeller Bar.
Cloudy golden coloured with a medium sized white head.
Malty aroma of hay and caramel with notes of hops.
Malty flavour of hay, caramel and hops.
Hoppy finish.

As a mild version of Mikkellers American Dream; Pilsener "fresh", mild sweetness and some mild IPA style hop.

  Very fresh. Very nice in the sun.

 Purchased on tap at Mikkeller Bar.

Draft. A hazy dark golden beer with a lazing beige head. The aroma has notes of hay, malt, and grain - summer meadow. The flavor is subdued sweet with lovely notes of malt, hay, and a bit of citrus, leading to a bitter finish.

Draught at Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fa. Hazy golden with a big and fluffy white head. Aroma of hay and grass with fine pilsner malt character of biscuit and bread crust. Sweetish malty flavour with a touch of German hops and medium bitterness. Clean and refreshing, tasty beer!

UPDATED: JUN 7, 2016 Draught at Festival der Bierkulturen, Köln: Golden, hazy, greenish-grainy nose with a solid hoppy background; solid bitter-sweet flavour, light bodied, a bit fizzy; lingering hoppy and light sweet pale-malty finish. Not bad, a needs a better lagering.......Re-rate 2016:Modderatee to solid hoppy and fruity nose, herbal and a bit piney background; moderate to solid dry bitter-sweet flavour with a slightly subdued sweetness; lingering dryish herbal-hoppy finish with a nice malty  sweetness. Fine, fine...

UPDATED: JUL 2, 2012 Tap @ Ma Che Siete, Rome Pours unclear yellow with a small creamy white head and lacings. Nose is fresh and grassy hoppy with a bit of diacetyl and buiscuit. Fresh, crisp, dry and elegant with some woody notes. Daaammnnn. Tap @ Ganstaller/Drei Kronen. Just really lovely smooth and soft. World class. 3,8 -4.

Draught at Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fà, Roma. Clear golden with a medium white head. Aroma and flavour of light malt, grass, and lemony hops. A touch acidic in the finish but this is due to it not being the freshest keg. Still its very pleasant to drink as is. Would love to try this super fresh though!
Draught at Moeder Lambic. Clear golden - white head. Nice malty. White bread. Light sweetness. Nice light hoppy. Grassy. Crispy. Fresh. Nice.

UPDATED: MAY 24, 2012 Draught (gravity) @ 16th Reading CAMRA Beer and Cider Festival 2010, England.Hazy medium orange color with a large, creamy to frothy, good lacing, fully lasting, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, grain, hay, cereal, woody, hoppy. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20100430]   7-3-7-3-14 
Draught @ Zoiglstube Gänstaller Drei Kronen Straßgiech, Drosendorfer Straße 24, Schesslitz-Strassgiech, Bavaria Germany 96110.Unclear matt medium yellow - orange colour with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white to off-white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, caramel, moderate hoppy, fruity. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and light to moderate bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20120406]  7-3-8-3-16

On tap at In de Wildeman. Slightly hazy golden colour, white head. Aroma of light sweet malts, yeast and hops. Flavour is malty, light sweet, light bready, good yeasty and hoppy bitter finish. Light to medium bodied. Highly drinkable.
On tap at Reading BF 2010.  Very hazy copper colour, lasting cream head.  Bit of lager puke on aroma, bit woody in mouth.  Its ok, quite full in mouth, bit creamy.  Odd woody finish.

In short: A kick-ass hoppy lager.
How: Tap at Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fà, Rome Italy
The look: Almost clear blonde body topped by a medium white head
In long: Nice nose of dry grassy noble hops and fresh lemongrass.   Superb crisp body with a very active carbonation.  A little smoother carbonation and this would have been a 5/5 mouthfeel.  Taste is crisp and sharp, more like a very hoppy pilsner than a typical Kellerbier.  Actually I ordered this beer and the girlfriend ordered the Tipopils (also tap) and side-by-side they tasted like brother and sister.  I still got that boiled egg-white juice that I get from most Kellerbier (only I gets that), a whole lot of cereals, some lemony meringue, dandelions, lemongrass, tropical fruits, some honey and a lot of Saaz-ish noble hops.  The finish is very dry with a sharp and short bitterness.  Hoppy session lager dont get much better than this.  This beer is out of this world.  And so is Zoigl, ruler of planet Gartek.

(draught) pours a murky golden colour with a fluffy white head. aroma of fresh, grassy herbal hops, some light gingerbread spice, hay and a hint of barnyard. flavour is the same, with underlying notes of bready, grainy malts, a subdued spiciness, more hay and a herbal hoppy bitter finish. medium-bodied with smooth carbonation.
chiara bella schiuma piuttosto persitente maltata dolceamaro buon corpo buon amaro fresco erbaceo
On tap at In de Wildeman. Hazy golden, thick offwhite head. Grassy hop bitterness, good and dry. Decent, but not oversexy.

Cask @ In de Wildeman, Amsterdam.
Pours hazy pale golden with a small, staying, creamy, white head. Nice lacings. Great duration. Soft hoppy aroma, grass, pistacio, fresh, sweet pilsner malts. Medium carbonation, great dry mouthfeel. Crisp malty flavour, super grassy hops dryness, lightly piney. Really extremely good and very drinkable.

Drunk there in the biergarten
a really good beer, even if an "easy" one, or better just because of it.

Served from the barrel.  Hazy straw.  Almost medicinal herbal hop character.  Very dry, yet retains rusticity.  Kind of minerally, which brings out some tannic bitterness to heighten the effect.  Interesting take on the tradition.  Tropical fruit notes in the finish.  Better than the sum of its parts.

The only beer on tap at the brewpub when we were there. Hazy as a weizen. Ochre yellow with lacing. Bright hoppy aroma is citrus and nice. Quaffable, nice mouthfeel with a chalky finish. The flavors are very hoppy, the finish is bright. Fresh woody flavors permeate and especially leave their mark on the finish.

UPDATED: MAR 12, 2016 It poured a hazy golden liquid with a medium sized icecream looking foam that left some lacing. At first I thought this beer smelled like some kind of cleaning liquid. But after a while the chemical parts dissapeared and left a more hoppy presence. It also smelled fresh with citrus. It also tasted very fresh with citrus, but also malt and hops. It worked great in the warm weather. Re-rated this on bottle in 2016 (first rated 2009). Nice with fruits, hay and wheat bread. Refreshing and easy to drink. Not chemical at all.

(Draught at Akkurat, Stockholm, 25 June 2009) Orangey yellow colour, hazy, with frothy white head. Malty, slightly fruity nose with notes of hay, grass and spicy hops. Malty taste with grain, hay, grass, toffee, butter and generous amounts of grassy, spicy hops in the finish. Very refreshing and tasty. Nice one.

Draught at Akkurat, Stockholm.  Hazy golden, rich firm head. Overtly grassy nose with plenty of butter underneath. Really dry and very hoppy, almost manages to be both soft, crisp and deep. Buttery malt drives it towards a marked salty bitter finish. Lovely lager!
